intro:
This new "Q" sequel isn't just about "drawing," but there are "players" involved.
Additionally, it supports multiplayer for up to four players
description:
"Q2 HUMANITY" is a completely new sequel to the "Q" series.

In the previous "Q" series, players cleared levels by using what they drew in a very simple physics-based puzzle game.
However, "Q2 HUMANITY" is a game where you not only "draw", but also utilize "character abilities" to tackle over 300 stages.
In addition to basic abilities like jumping, grabbing, throwing, and punching, there are characters who excel at throwing, can double jump, set off bombs, and even manipulate gravity, with a total of 18 characters each possessing unique special abilities.

What happens when characters with different special abilities come together?
What if characters with the same special ability come together?

The possibilities to solving these puzzles are limitless!
Will you cooperate to clear the tough stages...or rather hinder each other...?

"Q2 HUMANITY" supports both local and online multiplayer, allowing up to four players to join in.
Of course, you can also challenge it solo.

With no single correct answer, you can enjoy it multiple times with various approaches.
Experience both "the satisfaction of solo play" and "the fun of cooperative multiplayer" in this exceptionally versatile game.
Please enjoy it to the fullest!
